text: Tymbarcha cerinopa is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is commonly found in Eastern India (Assam). The wingspan of this moth is about 13 mm. The forewings are whitish-ochreous, the veins more ochreous, strewn with small tufts of scales finely sprinkled with blackish, tending to be arranged in transverse series. The basal patch, a narrow central fascia starting from a small whitish spot on the costa, and a streak along the posterior part of the costa and termen are suffusedly glistening silvery-whitish. The hindwings are pale whitish-grey-ochreous.J. Bombay Nat. Hist. Soc. 18: 622 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1908 Category:Tortricini Category:Moths of India Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Tymbarcha cerinopa
